prompt: <description>**Intermediate CAD Model Instructions** **Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with rounded corners** Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with rounded corners using the following steps: 1. Create a new coordinate system with no rotation or translation. 2. Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. 2.1. Draw a loop consisting of 4 lines: 2.1.1. A line with a start point at (0, 0) and end point at (0.1252, 0). 2.1.2. A line with a start point at (0.1252, 0) and end point at (0.1252, 0.2504). 2.1.3. A line with a start point at (0.1252, 0.2504) and end point at (0, 0.2504). 2.1.4. A line with a start point at (0, 0.2504) and end point at (0, 0). 3. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.2504. 4. Extrude the scaled 2D sketch along the normal vector with an extrusion depth of 0.2504. **Part 2: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly angled front face** Construct a rectangular prism as described below: 1. Create a new coordinate system with no rotation. Translate it along the z-axis by 0.2504. 2. Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. 3. Draw a loop consisting of 4 lines: 3.1. A line with a start point at (0, 0) and end point at (0.1252, 0). 3.2. A line with a start point at (0.1252, 0) and end point at (0.1252, 0.1252). 3.3. A line with a start point at (0.1252, 0.1252) and end point at (0, 0.1252). 3.4. A line with a start point at (0, 0.1252) and end point at (0, 0). 4. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.1252. 5. Extrude the scaled 2D sketch along the normal vector with an extrusion depth of 0.2504. Use the "JoinFeatureOperation" to add this part to the previous one. **Part 3: A three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides.** Construct this part following these steps: 1. Create a new coordinate system with no rotation. Translate it along the x-axis by 0.1252 and along the z-axis by 0.2504. 2. Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. 3. Draw a loop consisting of 4 lines: 3.1. A line with a start point at (0, 0) and end point at (0.3756, 0). 3.2. A line with a start point at (0.3756, 0) and end point at (0.3756, 0.1252). 3.3. A line with a start point at (0.3756, 0.1252) and end point at (0, 0.1252). 3.4. A line with a start point at (0, 0.1252) and end point at (0, 0). 4. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.3756. 5. Extrude the scaled 2D sketch along the normal vector with an extrusion depth of 0.1252. Use the "JoinFeatureOperation" to add this part to the previous one. **Final CAD Model** The final CAD model will have all the intermediate CAD models joined together to form a rectangular prism with a smaller rectangular prism attached to one of its sides. The dimensions of the final model are approximately 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height.</description>
